item.title: Robin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Robin add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Robin add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Robin add a quote by Peggy Hill, King of the Hill
item.description: "Why are men so attracted to hoes?" -- Peggy Hill, King of the Hill

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Sean Connery
item.description: "My first big break came when I was five years old. It's taken me more than seventy years to realise that. You see, at five I first learnt to read. It's that simple and it's that profound." -- Sean Connery

item.title: Robin add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Robin add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Robin add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Robin add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Robin add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Robin add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "You should never read just for "enjoyment." Read to make yourself smarter! Less judgmental. More apt to understand your friends' insane behavior, or better yet, your own. Pick "hard books." Ones you have to concentrate on while reading. And for god's sake, don't let me ever hear you say, "I can't read fiction. I only have time for the truth." Fiction is the truth, fool! Ever hear of "literature"? That means fiction, too, stupid." -- John Waters

item.title: Robin add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Robin add a quote by Amy Sedaris
item.description: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone." -- Amy Sedaris

item.title: Robin add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Robin add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Robin add a quote by Richard Brinsley Sheridan
item.description: "Never say more than is necessary." -- Richard Brinsley Sheridan

item.title: Robin add a quote by Samuel Pepys
item.description: "Strange to see how a good dinner and feasting reconciles everybody." -- Samuel Pepys

item.title: Robin add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Robin add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "My little old dog a heart-beat at my feet" -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Robin add a quote by Brian Selznick
item.description: "Maybe we are all cabinets of wonders." -- Brian Selznick

item.title: Robin add a quote by Joni Mitchell
item.description: "We are stardust, we are golden and we've got to get ourselves back to the garden." -- Joni Mitchell

item.title: Robin add a quote by Sharon Olds
item.description: "I was a late bloomer. But anyone who blooms at all, ever, is very lucky. " -- Sharon Olds

item.title: Robin add a quote by Laurence Sterne
item.description: "What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything." -- Laurence Sterne

item.title: Robin add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Robin add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "One day in the country Is worth a month in town" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Robin add a quote by Eleanor Hodgman Porter
item.description: "Be glad. Be good. Be brave." -- Eleanor Hodgman Porter

item.title: Robin add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Robin add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Compassion is the basis of morality." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Robin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë
